TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IProcess

Docs.summary: The interface that must be implemented by an assembly to process items as part of a search and process operation.

remarks.para: Search and process operations enable you to use Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010 to perform a search query, and then perform a specific, custom action upon each list item returned by the query. For example, you might need to identify a certain set of documents, based on specific document metadata, and then move those documents into a records repository.
This interface provides access to the processing to be done on each item in the return set of the search operation.
To perform a search and process operation, you must create a object, and then use the method to add the search and process operation to the SharePoint Server 2010 master timer job.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ProcessItem (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItem item, string[] rgstrOtherArgs, out string strMessage);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ProcessItem(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItem item, string[] rgstrOtherArgs, [out] string& strMessage) cil managed
Public Function ProcessItem (item As SPListItem, rgstrOtherArgs As String(), ByRef strMessage As String) As Boolean
public: bool ProcessItem(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPListItem ^ item, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ rgstrOtherArgs, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % strMessage);

Docs.param: Any optional arguments the user specified for SharePoint Server 2010 to pass to the assembly.
An output parameter for the assembly to return detailed processing information to SharePoint Server 2010.
Docs.summary: Performs custom processing on the specified item.
Docs.returns: A Boolean that specifies whether the item was successfully processed.

remarks.para: During a search and process operation, SharePoint Server 2010 calls the ProcessItem method once for each item in the search return set.

SharePoint Server 2010 stores the Boolean success indicator, as well as any detailed information returned from the parameter, for each item processed. SharePoint Server 2010 includes this information in the search and process job summary report that is sent in e-mail to the specified users.
For more information about how SharePoint Server 2010 invokes the interface during search and process operations, see Search and Process Development Process.
